intro: Sida anarthra, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky hairs covering its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Sida anarthra is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showing its adaptability to various environments.
